results.title: Pembrokeshire, my county
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Andrew Rice and Ronald Stark
results.brief_description: A film on the Welsh country of Pembrokeshire,, through the seasons, showing the scenic beauty of the countryside, buildings of interest, and something of agriculture and social life of the country. Highlights of the film include shots of abundant wild life of the region, pleasures of sailing at Milford and unique scenes in the Cistercian monastery at Caldey Island.

results.title: Pelle the conqueror = Pelle Erobreren
results.creator_credit: Per Holst Filmproduktion, Danish Film Institute, Svensk Filmindustri, Per Holst and Bille August
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Martin Andrew Nexos “Pelle the Conqueror” is the epic adventure of two Swedish refugees - eleven year-old Pelle and his elderly, widowed father Lasse (played by Oscar nominee Max Von Sydow). They sail to Denmark in search of a better existence but their dreams quickly fade when they realise that life is not any easier in their new country. Faced with extreme cruelty and poverty, Pelle develops an inner strength that helps him to endure the hardships. Armed with the determination to succeed, he sets out alone to conquer the world. Also stars Pelle Hvengaard, Erik Paaske, Bjorn Granath. Awarded Best Film - Cannes 1988; Best Foreign Film - Oscar 1988 Original subtitled version.

results.title: Pelicans
results.brief_description: Shows pelicans flying together in flocks, building their nests, hatching heir eggs and caring for heir young. Shows the attempts of the young to fly.

results.title: Pelican Island
results.brief_description: Down south in Florida where Ponde De Leon ages ago sought the spring of eternal youth, there is a queer island inhabited by pelicans. Burlington studies the map to see how the pelican get there.

results.title: Pele: the master and his method
results.brief_description: Depicts ball passing mehods, including wall pass, short chip, instep drive etc. Emphasizes role of the receiver and importance of thinking and the use of shouting.

results.title: Peiping family
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and William James
results.brief_description: Describes the daily life of a middle-class educated Chinese family in Peking including scenes of the children being taught in the family home by their mother who is a qualified teacher. This film was made prior to the declaration of the People’s Republic of China in 1949 and is seen through “western” eyes and “western” philosophy.

results.title: Peggy Sue got married
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Rastar Films, Zoetrope Studios, Paul R. Gurian and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Disillusioned with her life and the disintegration of her marriage to her childhood sweetheart (Nicolas Cage), former prom queen Peggy Sue (Kathleen Turner) reluctantly attends her 25 year high school reunion. Confronted by her past, she begins to regret her life choices and missed opportunities. Emotionally overwhelmed, she collapses during the reunion and awakens as herself 25 years earlier. Armed with experience and a second chance, she sets out, determined not repeat the same mistakes. A comedy fantasy film also starring Joan Allen, Helen Hunt, Jim Carrey, Maureen O’Sullivan, Leon Ames, John Carradine. Script, Jerry Leichtling and Arlene Sarner. Music, John Barry. Editing, Barry Malkin. Cinematography, Jordan Cronenweth.

results.title: Pegged in
results.brief_description: The secret life of a peg! A comic animation of common wooden pegs who, once left alone in a laundry basket, come to life and sprout legs. This quirky short has the pegs getting caught up in a string, one burns itself of an iron, and they all conspire to release two of their fellow pegs from a shirt pocket, in the process cause chaos.

results.title: Pegged in
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, David Atkinson, John Bird and Michael Eaglesome
results.brief_description: A handful of pegs get up to no good when the house lady leaves them alone with a basket full of freshly dried clothes. This student live animation is an excerise in punchline storytelling with a carefree humour and jazzy soundtrack.

results.title: Peg: a life to remember
results.brief_description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
